page.title: 14FORESTRY IN THE AREA
page.content: Approximately 178 acres of woodland occur in this Domesday block. 120 acres of this is cutivated and worked by 2 full-time{foresters}on a cmmercial basis.It is mixed woodland, the{conifers}grown are European and Japanese Larch, Norway & Sitka Spruce, Grandis & Douglas Firs.The main { {deciduous trees}grown are Oak,Ash, Poplar and Cherry. The wood produced goes for building materials in the form of"saw-logs",8"in diameter;the smaller wood is sold as "bars"for fencing,paper-pulp and chip-boarding. The regular work of the foresters includes raising plantations,clearing, coppicing and underlashing the established woods. Every 4-5 years the established woods are thinned out for selling. The remaining 58 acres of woods in the area are old established hardwoods,untouched and wild.
